hourlyPerformanceBoxPlot.title: Performance by Hour (Distribution)
hourlyPerformanceBoxPlot.label: PnL Distribution
hourlyPerformanceBoxPlot.boxDescription: Box: Central 50% of trades (Q1 to Q3)
hourlyPerformanceBoxPlot.outliersDescription: Dots: Exceptional values (blue = gains, pink = losses)

correlation.title: PnL vs Number of Trades Correlation
correlation.label: Correlation
correlation.rSquaredTooltip: The coefficient of determination (R²) measures the strength of the correlation between the number of trades and PnL. R² close to 1 indicates a strong correlation, R² close to 0 indicates a weak correlation. The regression line shows the general trend.

durationVsPnl.title: Trade Duration vs P/L
durationVsPnl.tooltip: Visualize how the duration of each trade impacts the net P/L. Helps identify whether shorter or longer trades are more profitable.

sizeVsPnl.title: Position Size vs P/L
sizeVsPnl.tooltip: Compare position size (and exposure) against net P/L. Bubble size reflects exposure to highlight which trades move the needle most.

featureCorrelationMatrix.title: Feature Correlation Matrix
featureCorrelationMatrix.tooltip: Measures linear correlation between key variables (P/L, size, duration, entry hour, direction). Values close to ±1 indicate strong relationships.
featureCorrelationMatrix.description: Coefficient values range from -1 (strong inverse relationship) to +1 (strong direct relationship). Values near 0 indicate little or no linear correlation.

drawdown.title: Daily Drawdown
drawdown.label: Drawdown
drawdown.tooltip: This chart shows the distance from your best level (peak). The line at 0 represents your peak. The higher the value, the further you are from your best level. When you reach a new peak, the drawdown returns to 0. Percentages (%) represent the percentage of loss from the peak. For example, 10% means you have lost 10% compared to your best level.

heatmap.title: Performance by Day of Week and Hour
heatmap.tooltip: This heatmap shows your performance (PnL) by day of the week and by hour. Each cell represents the total PnL for a day/hour combination. Blue colors indicate gains, pink colors indicate losses. The more intense the color, the higher the value. Only hours with data are displayed, with one hour of context before and after.

pnlDistribution.title: PnL Distribution
pnlDistribution.label: Percentage of trades
pnlDistribution.tooltip: This chart shows the distribution of your PnL (profits and losses) by grouping trades into value intervals. Each bar represents a PnL interval and its height indicates the percentage of trades that fall within that interval. This helps identify the most frequent PnL ranges in your trading.

gainsVsLosses.title: Gains vs Losses Distribution
gainsVsLosses.tooltip: This chart compares the distribution of your gains and losses separately. The left histogram shows the distribution of winning trades by value ranges, and the right one shows the distribution of losing trades. This helps identify patterns and compare the distribution of gains and losses to optimize your strategy.

maeMfe.title: MAE vs MFE
maeMfe.tooltip: Analysis of Maximum Adverse Excursion (worst move against you) vs Maximum Favorable Excursion (best move in your favor). Points in the upper left indicate well-managed trades (low MAE, high MFE).
maeMfe.noData: No MAE/MFE data available for this period

monthlyPerformance.title: Monthly/Annual Performance
monthlyPerformance.tooltip: This chart shows your performance (PnL) by month. Each bar represents the total PnL for a given month. This helps identify the most profitable months and seasonal trends.

tradingVolume.title: Trading Volume Over Time
tradingVolume.label: Number of trades
tradingVolume.tooltip: This chart shows the number of trades per day over time. This helps identify periods of intense activity and quiet periods.

tradesDistribution.title: Trades Distribution by Result
tradesDistribution.tooltip: This chart shows the distribution of your trades between winners, losers and neutral. This allows you to quickly visualize the ratio of winning vs losing trades.

riskReward.title: Risk/Reward Ratio Over Time
riskReward.label: Average R:R ratio
riskReward.tooltip: This chart shows the evolution of the average risk/reward ratio (R:R) over time. A ratio greater than 1 indicates that average gains are greater than average losses. This helps evaluate the effectiveness of your risk management over time.

radar.title: Overall Performance
radar.subtitle: Key metrics analysis
radar.tooltip: This radar chart displays 5 essential metrics normalized from 0 to 100. The larger the surface, the better your performance. 50 = minimum target, 75+ = excellent performance.
radar.scoreTooltip: Global score calculated as the average of the 5 normalized metrics. Each metric is evaluated on a scale of 0 to 100 based on realistic trading benchmarks. The higher the score, the better your overall performance.

equityCurve.title: Equity Curve
equityCurve.tooltip: This chart shows the evolution of your capital over time. The green curve represents your current capital (initial capital + cumulative PnL). The gray dashed line indicates your initial capital for reference. This allows you to visualize the growth or decline of your capital over time.
